title: French interior minister under pressure after Paris knife attack
text:
French Interior Minister Christophe Castaner | Bertrand Guay/AFP via Getty Images French interior minister under pressure after Paris knife attack Opposition politicians criticize Christophe Castaner’s handling of investigation.

A French opposition senator on Saturday demanded the resignation of Interior Minister Christophe Castaner, after a police employee killed four colleagues in a case now under investigation by counter-terrorism police.

Guillaume Larrivé, a politician from the center-right Les Républicains party, accused Castaner of failing in his duties and called for him to step down as a “matter of national security.”

"Enough is enough. The interior minister is not capable of assuming its responsibilities. He cannot remain in office. This is a matter of national security," Larrivé tweeted.

Officials have not said there was a terror motive behind the attack in the center of Paris, but the case was on Friday evening transferred to the national anti-terrorist prosecutor for investigation.

The 45-year-old attacker — an IT specialist who had worked at the police headquarters for more than 15 years — converted to Islam around 18 months ago.

Questions have been raised around how the authorities dealt with evidence and responded to the attack, Le Parisien reported.

Christian Jacob, the Républicains party leader, alongside parliamentarian Eric Ciotti, on Saturday said they would call for the creation of a parliamentary committee to investigate how the minister handled the investigation.
